snippet: NXP Semiconductors will pay $11.8 billion for Freescale Semiconductor, a smaller rival, in a merger that creates a major maker of chips for a range of industries.
abstract: NXP Semiconductors says it will acquire Freescale Semiconductor for $11.8 billion, creating major chip maker.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: NXP Semiconductors will pay $11.8 billion for Freescale Semiconductor, a smaller rival, in a merger that creates a major maker of chips for a range of industries.

headline.main: Chip Makers Will Merge in Deal Worth $11.8 Billion
headline.print_headline: Chip Makers Will Merge in Deal Worth $11.8 Billion
